TopicTitle: What is the difference between part IDs in persistent.sfs?

Articles.Content:
There are three part IDs in the save file: cid, uid and mid. What is the difference between them? I need to find one that is persistent across docking and saving/loading (which seems to be flightID in the game).

Thanks,

Marian

uid in the persistent.sfs is FlightID in code with the game running. (This one I've tested.) This is a random, unique number assigned to each part in the game.

mid is probably MissionID, I think this number is the same number assigned to all parts on a vessel at launch, but does not change when vessels dock. (Unlike Vessel.ID which does change on dock/undock) Note I have not tested this one.

No clue on cid though.

D.
